Package database

Class LinearizedData

java.lang.Object
database.LinearizedData
All Implemented Interfaces:
Function
public class LinearizedData extends Object implements Function
The backbone of all data analysis. LinearizedData is the structure that holds functional data for quick access (log(n)), modification (constant or log(n)), and concatenation (constant)
Author:
Yuelong Li

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    append(double time, double value)
    Appends the specified time and value at the end of the data array if it is the latest in time, else returns false, defaults the storable attribute of the new data entry to true
    boolean
    append(double time, double value, boolean storable)
    Appends the specified time and value at the end of the data array if it is the latest in time, else returns false
    void
    clear()
    Clears the data contained in this without affecting the concatenated data
    LinearizedData
    concatenate(LinearizedData b)
    Concatenates this with another sheet of linearized data to form a entirety, the data range of them cannot overlap and the one with an later data range is sorted to the front, the process is recursive and maintains the content and reference of concatenated data.
    double
    get(double time)
    Binary searches and returns the data at the given time, takes a linear approximation if time is between two data points, returns NAN if time is not within range
    DataEntry
    getFirst()
    Recursively finds the linearized data block that comes the earliest in the concatenation chain, and returns its first entry

    Unit testing
    void
    set(double time, double value)
    Adds the time, value pair to the data array of this if time is within the range of it, if time is before the range, checks if the concatenated data exists before adding it to the data array of this (if concatenated == null).

    • get

      public double get(double time)
      Binary searches and returns the data at the given time, takes a linear approximation if time is between two data points, returns NAN if time is not within range

    • getNext

      public double getNext(double time)
      Binary searches and returns the data at the data point up next to the given time, takes a linear approximation if time is between two data points, returns NAN if time is not within range
      Parameters:
      time -
      Returns:
      the data point at time

    • set

      public void set(double time, double value)
      Adds the time, value pair to the data array of this if time is within the range of it, if time is before the range, checks if the concatenated data exists before adding it to the data array of this (if concatenated == null). In this way the order in data streams can be maintained => time strictly increasing.
      Parameters:
      time -
      value -

    • append

      public boolean append(double time, double value)
      Appends the specified time and value at the end of the data array if it is the latest in time, else returns false, defaults the storable attribute of the new data entry to true
      Parameters:
      time -
      value -
      Returns:
      whether the append have happened successfully

    • append

      public boolean append(double time, double value, boolean storable)
      Appends the specified time and value at the end of the data array if it is the latest in time, else returns false
      Parameters:
      time -
      value -
      storable - indicates whether the newly created data entry will be stored on the system disk
      Returns:

    • getFirst

      public DataEntry getFirst()
      Recursively finds the linearized data block that comes the earliest in the concatenation chain, and returns its first entry
      Returns:
      the first entry of the linearized data chain

    • getLast

      public DataEntry getLast()
      Returns:
      the last data entry in this.dataArray

    • concatenate

      public LinearizedData concatenate(LinearizedData b)
      Concatenates this with another sheet of linearized data to form a entirety, the data range of them cannot overlap and the one with an later data range is sorted to the front, the process is recursive and maintains the content and reference of concatenated data.
      Parameters:
      b - the other sheet of linearized data to be concatenated
      Returns:
      the linearized data that is the combination of b and this

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the data contained in this without affecting the concatenated data
